com.cloudgarden.jigloo.wizards
Class NewFormWizard

java.lang.Object
  org.eclipse.jface.wizard.Wizard
      com.cloudgarden.jigloo.wizards.NewFormWizard
All Implemented Interfaces:
org.eclipse.ui.INewWizard, org.eclipse.jface.wizard.IWizard, org.eclipse.ui.IWorkbenchWizard
public class NewFormWizard
extends org.eclipse.jface.wizard.Wizard
implements org.eclipse.ui.INewWizard

This is the Wizard from which all Jigloo Wizards are derived. It contains protected methods which should be overwritten to define the location and name of the template file or files etc. The templates should take this general form (the initGUI method is not necessary): 

%PKG_NAME%

public class %CLASS_NAME% extends %SUPERCLASS_NAME% {

        public static void main(String[] args) {
                %CLASS_NAME% inst = new %CLASS_NAME%();
                // do any default operations on inst...
        }

        public %CLASS_NAME%() {
                super();
                initGUI();
        }

        private void initGUI() {
                try {
                // ... do default initialization
                } catch (Exception e) {
                        e.printStackTrace();
                }
        }
}
%PKG_NAME% should *always* be present, and will be automatically replaced.
%CLASS_NAME% will be replaced by the user-defined class name (which they will enter in the wizard when creating the class).
%SUPERCLASS_NAME% is defined by overwriting NewFormWizard.getFormSuperclassName()

Template files should live in the com/cloudgarden/jigloo/wizards/templates folder, but may live in a subfolder of this folder, provided the getTemplatePackage points to this subfolder. For example, NewSWTInheritanceExampleWizard overrides getTemplatePackage to return "swt/" and it's templates live in the com/cloudgarden/jigloo/wizards/templates/swt folder.

addPages

Adding the page to the wizard.

Specified by:
addPages in interface org.eclipse.jface.wizard.IWizard

classExists

boolean classExists()

performFinish

public boolean performFinish()
This method is called when 'Finish' button is pressed in the wizard. We will create an operation and run it using wizard as execution context.

Specified by:
performFinish in interface org.eclipse.jface.wizard.IWizard

isSingleFile

protected boolean isSingleFile()
If this method returns true then this Wizard produces a single file, which should be named by overwriting the getTemplateName method.

If this method returns false then this Wizard produces multiple files, which should be named by overwriting the getTemplateNames method.

See Also:
#getTemplateName, #getTemplateNames

isExample

protected boolean isExample()
Overwrite this method to return true if the class being generated is an example rather than a standard GUI class. Default is false.

addAbstractMethods

protected boolean addAbstractMethods()
Overwrite this method to return false if you *don't* want an abstract methods in the template class to be automatically generated as stub methods. Default is true.

needsSWRResMan

protected boolean needsSWRResMan()
Overwrite this method to return true if this class needs the SWTResourceManager class to be generated in the project. Default is false.

build

protected void build(org.eclipse.core.resources.IFile javaFile)

getFormSuperclass

public java.lang.Class getFormSuperclass()

doBuildAtEnd

protected boolean doBuildAtEnd()

getTemplateName

protected java.lang.String getTemplateName()
If isSingleFile() returns true, this method will be used to get the name of the template file which will be used to generate the class for this wizard. If isSingleFile() returns false, then this method should return the *main* class of the set of classes (this is the class that the user will be able to name using the wizard).

getTemplatePackage

protected java.lang.String getTemplatePackage()
Overwrite this method to return the additional path inside the com/cloudgarden/jigloo/wizards/templates folder where the template or templates live. The value must end in a "/", eg "swt/".

getTemplateNames

protected java.lang.String[] getTemplateNames()
If isSingleFile() returns false, this method will be used to get the names of all the template files which will be used to generate classes for this wizard.

getFormSuperclassName

protected java.lang.String getFormSuperclassName()
If overwritten will be used to suggest a superclass to the user when they use the wizard to create a new class (the user may then change this value to extend a different class).

init

public void init(org.eclipse.ui.IWorkbench workbench,
                 org.eclipse.jface.viewers.IStructuredSelection selection)
We will accept the selection in the workbench to derive the project and package that the class or classes should be generated in.

Specified by:
init in interface org.eclipse.ui.IWorkbenchWizard
See Also:
IWorkbenchWizard.init(IWorkbench, IStructuredSelection)

getPackageName

protected java.lang.String getPackageName()
Overwrite to return a default package name for the generated class (eg, "examples.swing.slidergame). Default is null, which will use the package name of the currently-selected package in Eclipse.
